alert.note: Alert for Darlington; Florence (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wilmington (Northeastern South Carolina and Southeastern North Carolina - Wilmington)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued September 29 at 10:23AM EDT until further notice by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Wilmington NC has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in South Carolina... Great Pee Dee River At Pee Dee affecting Marion and Florence Counties. Black Creek At Quinby affecting Darlington and Florence Counties. For the Great Pee Dee River...including Pee Dee, Bennettsville 10sw...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Black Creek...including Black Creek Nr Hartsville, Quinby... Minor flooding is forecast.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=ilm. The next statement will be issued by this evening. SCC031-041-300830- /O.NEW.KILM.FL.W.0016.221001T1334Z-000000T0000Z/ /BCRS1.1.ER.221001T1334Z.221003T0000Z.000000T0000Z.NO/ 1023 AM EDT Thu Sep 29 2022 ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Black Creek At Quinby. * WHEN...From this evening until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 14.0 feet, Floodwaters surround the majority of homes on East Black Creek Road, Creekside Drive and Crooked Creek Drive and all residents are isolated due to the floodwaters. Water is lapping at the foundations of all ground level homes in these areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:00 AM EDT Thursday the stage was 3.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late Saturday morning and continue rising to a crest of 14.5 feet Sunday evening. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
